text.div:
Universal ID Type

CodeDescriptionCommentVersion
B deprecatedadded v2.5.1, removed after v2.5.1
CLIA Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments. Allows for the ability to designate organization identifier as a "CLIA" assigned number (for labs)added v2.7
CLIP Clinical laboratory Improvement Program. Allows for the ability to designate organization identifier as a "CLIP" assigned number (for labs).Â  Used by US Department of Defense.added v2.7
DNS An Internet host name, in accordance with RFC 1035; or an IP address. Either in ASCII or as integers, with periods between components ("dotted" notation).added v2.3
EUI64 IEEE 64-bit Extended Unique Identifier is comprised of a 24-bit company identifier and a 40-bit instance identifier. The value shall be formatted as 16 ASCII HEX digits, for example, "AABBCC1122334455". The 24-bit company identifier, formally known as OUI-24 values are administered by the IEEE Registration Authority.added v2.7
GUID Same as UUID.Retained for backward compatibility only as of v2.7; use UUID insteadadded v2.3
HCD The CEN Healthcare Coding Scheme DesignatorRetained for backward compatibility only as of v2.7; does not identify Assigning Authoritiesadded v2.3
HL7 HL7 registration schemesRetained for backward compatibility only as of v2.7; HL7 assigns ISO OIDs for Assigning Authoritiesadded v2.3
ISO An International Standards Organization Object Identifier (OID), in accordance with ISO/IEC 8824. Formatted as decimal digits separated by periods; recommended limit of 64 charactersadded v2.3
L These are reserved for locally defined coding schemes.Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.8added v2.3
L,M,N Locally defined coding entity identifier.Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.8added v2.3
M These are reserved for locally defined coding schemes.Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.8added v2.3
N These are reserved for locally defined coding schemes.Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.8added v2.3
Random Usually a base64 encoded string of random bits.Retained for backward compatibility only as of v2.7; equivalent to a locally defined entity identifier scheme; use L. M, or N instead.added v2.3
URI Uniform Resource Identifieradded v2.5
UUID The DCE Universal Unique Identifier, in accordance with RFC 4122. Recommended format is 32 hexadecimal digits separated by hyphens, in the digit grouping 8-4-4-4-12added v2.3
x400 An X.400 MHS identifier. Recommended format is in accordance with RFC 1649added v2.3
x500 An X.500 directory nameadded v2.3

name: v2 Universal ID Type
description: FHIR Value set/code system definition for HL7 v2 table 0301 ( Universal ID Type)

extension.valueString: Clinical laboratory Improvement Amendments. Ondersteunt gebruik van organisatie-identificatie als een nummer toegekend door "CLIA" (voor labs). In gebruik bij Amerikaanse ministerie van defensie

contains.display: Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments. Allows for the ability to designate organization identifier as a "CLIA" assigned number (for labs)

extension.valueString: Clinical laboratory Improvement Program. Ondersteunt gebruik van organisatie-identificatie als een nummer toegekend door "CLIP" (voor labs). In gebruik bij Amerikaanse ministerie van defensie

contains.display: Clinical laboratory Improvement Program. Allows for the ability to designate organization identifier as a "CLIP" assigned number (for labs).Â  Used by US Department of Defense.

extension.valueString: Een internet hostname, conform RFC 1035; of een IP-adres. In ASCII-tekens of als integers, met punten tussen componenten ("puntnotatie").

contains.display: An Internet host name, in accordance with RFC 1035; or an IP address. Either in ASCII or as integers, with periods between components ("dotted" notation).

extension.valueString: IEEE 64-bit Extended Unique Identifier bestaat uit een 24-bit bedrijfsidentificatie en een 40-bit instance-identificatie. De waarde moet 16 ASCII HEX tekens lang zijn, bijvoorbeeld, "AABBCC1122334455". De 24-bit bedrijfsidentificatie, voorheen bekend als Organizationally Unique Identifier (OUI-24), is gegarandeerd wereldwijd uniek. De 40-bit extensies worden toegekend door fabrikanten. Deze identificatie wordt meest gebruikt in apparaatinterfaces (bijv., "MAC" adressen voor IPv4 & IPv6). [Zie http://standards.ieee.org/regauth/oui/tutorials/EUI64.html voor een gedetailleerde uitleg van de structuur.]

contains.display: IEEE 64-bit Extended Unique Identifier is comprised of a  24-bit company identifier and a 40-bit instance identifier.  The value shall be formatted as 16 ASCII HEX digits, for example, "AABBCC1122334455".  The 24-bit company identifier, formally known as

extension.valueString: De CEN Healthcare Coding Scheme Designator

contains.display: The CEN Healthcare Coding Scheme Designator

extension.valueString: Een Internationaal Standaardisatie Orgaan Object IDentificatie (OID), conform ISO/IEC 8824. Structuur is decimale getallen gescheiden door punten; aanbevolen grens is 64 tekens.

contains.display: An International Standards Organization Object Identifier (OID), in accordance with ISO/IEC 8824.  Formatted as decimal digits separated by periods; recommended limit of 64 characters

extension.valueString: Deze zijn gereserveerd voor lokaal gedefinieerde codesystemen

contains.display: These are reserved for locally defined coding schemes.

extension.valueString: Deze zijn gereserveerd voor lokaal gedefinieerde codesystemen
Deze zijn gereserveerd voor lokaal gedefinieerde codesystemen

contains.display: These are reserved for locally defined coding schemes.

extension.valueString: Deze zijn gereserveerd voor lokaal gedefinieerde codesystemen

contains.display: These are reserved for locally defined coding schemes.

extension.valueString: Meestal een base64 gecodeerde string met willekeurige bits.

contains.display: Usually a base64 encoded string of random bits.

extension.valueString: De DCE Universal Unique Identifier, conform RFC 4122. Aanbevolen structuur is 32 hexadecimale getalen gescheiden door koppeltekens, met cijfergroepering 8-4-4-4-12

contains.display: The DCE Universal Unique Identifier, in accordance with RFC 4122. Recommended format is 32 hexadecimal digits separated by hyphens, in the digit grouping 8-4-4-4-12

extension.valueString: Een X.400 MHS identificatie. Aanbevolen format is conform RFC 1649

contains.display: An X.400 MHS identifier. Recommended format is in accordance with RFC 1649
